A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
A FAILURE at every level:

[1] FAILED as a Sequel by completely disregarding all the questions Force Awakens set up.

[2] FAILED as a middle instalment by killing off anticipation for Episode IX.

[3] FAILED at humour because the 'jokes' were cringe-worthy and distracting. 

[4] Failed at pathos/drama because even the death of Luke Skywalker had no emotional impact.

[5] FAILED at Sci-Fi because apparently there's gravity to make bombs fall in space and people can survive and even fly in its vacuum. 

[6] FAILED at fantasy by diminishing the idea of heroes and taking a giant dump on SW mythology and lore.

[7] FAILED as entertainment because it was the first SW film that felt too long.

[8] FAILED at political commentary because it was so heavy-handed audiences felt lectured. 

[9] FAILED at "being" Star Wars because even the prequels captured more of the spirit of SW than this.

[10] FAILED box-office expectations by having the biggest 2nd week plunge in film history.
